title: Yiwei Lu
text:
üöÄ What‚Äôs Coming


Over the past year, I‚Äôve taken ideas from early-stage concepts to functional prototypes‚Äîexploring how data, design, and human behavior intersect in the startup world. This page documents my journey across projects like Klug Forecast AI, Platemate: from scribbled wireframes to live web apps, and everything in between.I‚Äôm working on detailed write-ups, behind-the-scenes insights, and lessons learned from each startup. These will include ideation process, stack choices, user research, and what failed along the way (yes, that too). Full story launching soon. Stay tuned!





Let‚Äôs stay in touch ‚Äî here‚Äôs where to find me online.

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Prediction Dashboard
Uber Driver Prediction Dashboard
Datathon 2025 Competition üèÜ ‚ÄúBest Use of StrataScratch DC‚Äù üèÜ
As part of Team SYNTAX ERROR, developed a machine learning dashboard to predict whether new Uber sign-ups would convert into active drivers. Combined XGBoost with KMeans to analyze onboarding patterns, achieving 0.97 AUC. SHAP analysis highlighted onboarding delays and signup source as key drivers.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Review Sentiment App
Airbnb Sentiment Application & Hosting Strategy
Developed a sentiment analysis app for Airbnb hosts using NLP and XGBoost. The app predicts whether a review is positive or negative, visualizes key terms through word clouds, and allows users to flag incorrect predictions. These user-labeled responses are designed to support future supervised model retraining for improved accuracy and adaptability.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
E-Commerce Database
E-Commerce SQL & Relational Database Design
Designed a relational data model and normalized schema for a global fashion retailer. Wrote SQL queries to support churn prediction, marketing attribution, return behavior analysis, and inventory optimization.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Anemia Prediction
Predicting Anemia with Machine Learning
Developed classification models using blood test data to predict anemia, focusing on early detection support. Leveraged feature selection techniques to identify the most relevant clinical indicators and applied SMOTE to address class imbalance. Models such as Decision Trees and Logistic Regression were used to explore interpretability and predictive performance.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Obesity Risk Analysis
Obesity Risk Analysis and Behavioral Clustering
Conducted a comprehensive analysis of obesity risk using classification models, clustering techniques, and ANOVA. Explored lifestyle and dietary factors to uncover patterns linked to obesity. After segmenting individuals into behavioral clusters, we provided tailored recommendations for each group to support targeted public health interventions.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Deep Learning Chip Inspector
Deep Learning Classification and Automated Chip Inspection
Deep learning and computer vision are applied to identify defective potato chips and ensure consistent product quality. The automated system reduces labor costs, prevents waste, and safeguards brand reputation.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Technology Consulting
Smart Grocery Shopping Assistant
Hands-on consulting course focused on applying AI and analytics to real-world business problems. Topics include use case development, prompt engineering, product management, Agile delivery, and stakeholder alignment. Culminates in a Shark Tank‚Äìstyle team project judged by industry experts.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu

Analyzed Google Pixel‚Äôs weak market penetration despite technical strengths in AI and camera performance. Assessed brand positioning, competitive dynamics, and proposed strategic recommendations to enhance Pixel 9‚Äôs presence in the premium smartphone segment.
Read More

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Explore Capstone Project
Johnson & Johnson Cerenovus Capstone Project
Developed a full-stack analytics dashboard to support sales and retention strategy at Cerenovus, a Johnson & Johnson medical device division. Integrated SQL-based data pipelines, machine learning models (including churn prediction and clustering), and interactive visualizations to identify key revenue drivers, at-risk accounts, and regional product trends. The tool enables real-time exploration and supports strategic planning across sales teams.
Capstone Page

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
üöß This page is under development. Please check back soon.





¬© 2025 Yiwei Lu. All rights reserved.

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
(This page is still under development)


 Back to Home 







Executive Summary


Partnered with Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs Cerenovus division to address customer retention challenges in the neurovascular device market. At the outset, we matched J&J‚Äôs transactional sales data with third-party medical databases to enrich customer profiles and validate insights, while also developing exploratory dashboards in Power BI and Tableau to surface initial trends. As the project evolved, the team transitioned to a full-stack approach: SQL for scalable data integration, Python for feature engineering and predictive modeling, and React with Tailwind for an interactive dashboard. This end-to-end solution brought together customer segmentation, churn prediction, and product migration analysis in a single platform, enabling business teams to move seamlessly from data exploration to strategic decision-making.



Key Outcomes




Strong Predictive Model


NULL




Focused Risk Targeting


NULL




Business Value Creation


NULL




Retention Strategy Impact


NULL






Objectives



Predict Customer Churn: Develop models to identify which hospital or account is most at risk of leaving, enabling Johnson & Johnson to prioritize retention actions before revenue is lost.


Segment Customer Base: Use clustering to group accounts into meaningful profiles (e.g., High Revenue Contributors, Premium Spenders, Low Engagement) for tailored retention strategies.


Analyze Product Migration: Track shifts from older coils/stents to aspiration systems, revealing physician preferences and informing product portfolio planning.


Quantify Financial Impact: Translate predictive accuracy and segmentation insights into projected ROI, linking data science outputs to measurable business value.


Deliver Decision-Support Tools: Build interactive dashboards that connect churn predictions, segment profiles, and ROI scenarios, giving managers a clear path from insight to action.





Data & Features



Transactional Data Sources: Multi-year sales transaction tables containing FISCAL_YEAR, FISCAL_MONTH, revenue (SALES), product SKU and category, sales channel (distributors, direct), and geographic region. These served as the foundation for all modeling and segmentation.


Feature Engineering: Derived business-relevant metrics including:


RFM metrics (Recency, Frequency, Monetary) to capture customer behavior patterns.


Seasonality features (quarterly and monthly dummy variables) to account for cyclical purchasing behavior.


Product mix ratios to measure migration trends (e.g., coils ‚Üí stents ‚Üí aspiration systems).


Pricing tiers and discount bands to capture value sensitivity across accounts.


Recency windows (e.g., 3-, 6-, 12-month lookbacks) to measure recent activity and inactivity.




Data Quality & Standardization: Applied systematic cleaning steps:


Standardized product and channel naming across multiple source systems.


Handled missing values through imputation and logical rules (e.g., defaulting null channel codes).


Detected and capped outliers (e.g., unusually large one-off purchases) to prevent model distortion.


Cross-source alignment between transactional, regional, and product hierarchy tables to ensure consistency.




Final Feature Set: Combined raw transactional metrics and engineered variables into a structured dataset ready for churn modeling, clustering, and dashboard integration.





Methods



Data Preparation: Standardized multi-year transactional data (FISCAL_YEAR, FISCAL_MONTH, SALES, SKU, region, channel). Engineered RFM features (Recency, Frequency, Monetary value), product mix ratios, migration indicators, and seasonality flags.


Predictive Modeling:


Logistic Regression as baseline for interpretability and quick benchmarking.


XGBoost for high-performance classification, capturing nonlinear interactions and handling imbalanced churn outcomes.


Random Survival Forest (RSF) to estimate time-to-churn, providing survival probabilities over time.




Model Evaluation: Used ROC-AUC and Precision-Recall AUC to measure classification power, C-Index for survival analysis accuracy, and cost-benefit curves to test ROI under different marketing budget constraints.


Customer Segmentation: Applied K-Means clustering on engineered features. Identified distinct groups:


Premium Spenders ‚Äì high ticket size, ideal for exclusive offers.


Power Buyers ‚Äì frequent purchases, responsive to loyalty programs.


Low Engagement ‚Äì low spend and low frequency, requiring reactivation campaigns.




Visualization & Decision Support: Developed interactive dashboards (React + Tailwind + PostgreSQL) to connect predictions with segmentation and campaign planning for Johnson & Johnson managers.





Business Impact



Customer Retention: Early identification of high-risk accounts enabled targeted outreach strategies. Our models captured over 60% of churners in the top-risk deciles, ensuring sales teams can focus efforts on the most vulnerable accounts.


Revenue Protection: Conservative ROI scenarios projected an annual impact of +$1.2M through optimized retention campaigns, proving that predictive analytics can directly translate into measurable financial value.


Product Migration Insights: Analysis revealed a 45% migration from legacy coils/stents to newer aspiration systems (C71 series). This highlighted evolving physician preferences and informed product portfolio strategy.


Strategic Segmentation: Customer clustering uncovered distinct profiles‚ÄîHigh Revenue Contributors, Low Engagement, and Premium Spenders‚Äî giving marketing teams actionable levers for personalized messaging and differentiated retention offers.


Decision-Support Tools: Delivered an interactive React + Tailwind + PostgreSQL dashboard that closes the loop (prediction ‚Üí segmentation ‚Üí campaign design ‚Üí monitoring), enabling managers to make real-time, data-driven decisions.


Long-term Impact: Established a repeatable data pipeline and modeling workflow that can be extended beyond Cerenovus to other Johnson & Johnson divisions, strengthening enterprise-wide analytics capability.







Demo Video


Watch a short demo showcasing the interactive dashboard.





Interactive Dashboard


Built an end-to-end dashboard to visualize churn predictions, customer segments, and retention ROI scenarios.

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Welcome! I‚Äôm Yiwei Lu (David) ‚Äî a Business Analytics graduate from UC Irvine with a focus on transforming data into clear, actionable insights. My background spans projects in healthcare, e-commerce, and technology, where I‚Äôve worked closely with data to support business decisions, streamline operations, and enhance user experiences. I enjoy working at the intersection of data, strategy, and communication ‚Äî helping teams understand not just what the numbers say, but what they mean.
Outside of work, I‚Äôm a curious learner who enjoys exploring tech trends, visual storytelling, and problem-solving challenges. I also love to travel, explore new cultures, and capture moments through photography. My free time often includes hiking, snowboarding, badminton, and the occasional adventure off the beaten path‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs trying a new trail or discovering a hidden coffee shop in a new city. Whether in the workplace or beyond, I believe in asking thoughtful questions, staying open-minded, and building connections through shared goals.

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Technical Skills

Languages & Tools:
Experience with Python, R, and SPSS for data analysis. Familiar with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI and Google Analytics.
Cloud Platforms & Databases:
Background working with AWS services, as well as Microsoft Azure. Comfortable using both SQL and NoSQL databases, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra for scalable data storage and retrieval.
Data Management & Analysis:
Skilled in using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access for business reporting. Familiar with processing large datasets and integrating big data systems to extract trends and drive strategic decisions.
Soft Skills & Collaboration:
Strong time management and organizational skills with a proven ability to work independently under tight deadlines. Highly adaptable, with a collaborative mindset and a solution-oriented approach to problem-solving across cross-functional teams.

title: Yiwei Lu
text:
Mission

To bridge the gap between raw data and strategic decision-making, empowering businesses to make smarter, faster, and more informed choices.
I believe data is more than numbers ‚Äî it‚Äôs a narrative waiting to be uncovered. My mission is to transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that drive meaningful business outcomes. Whether it‚Äôs forecasting trends, optimizing operations, or identifying growth opportunities, I aim to provide tools and analysis that turn uncertainty into confident decision-making.
With every project, I strive to combine analytical precision with business intuition ‚Äî ensuring that data not only informs but inspires.

title: About Me
text:
Hello! I‚Äôm Yiwei Lu (David), a Business Analytics graduate from UC Irvine with a focus on transforming data into clear, actionable insights. My background spans projects in healthcare, retail, e-commerce, and technology, where I‚Äôve applied tools like Python, SQL, and Tableau to support business decisions, optimize operations, and improve user experiences. I enjoy working at the intersection of data, strategy, and communication‚Äîhelping teams understand not just what the numbers say, but what they mean.
Outside of work, I‚Äôm a curious learner who enjoys exploring tech trends, visual storytelling, and problem-solving challenges. I also love to travel, explore new cultures, and capture moments through photography. My free time often includes hiking, snowboarding, badminton, and the occasional adventure off the beaten path‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs trying a new trail or discovering a hidden coffee shop in a new city. Whether in the workplace or beyond, I believe in asking thoughtful questions, staying open-minded, and building connections through shared goals.




Student Analyst
Johnson & Johnson ‚Äî Jan 2025 ‚Äì Jun 2025
Business Analyst
CalHome Inc ‚Äî Oct 2021 ‚Äì Jul 2024
Consulting Intern
Fly Media (Shanghai) ‚Äî May 2019 ‚Äì Aug 2019






M.S. in Business Analytics, University of California, Irvine (Expected June 2025)
B.S. in Computer Information Systems, California State Polytechnic University, Pomona (May 2021)






Languages & Tools:
Proficient in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn), SQL (complex queries, joins, CTEs), R for statistical computing, and SPSS for data analysis. Experienced in Tableau for interactive dashboarding and Google Analytics for website traffic and campaign performance insights.
Cloud Platforms & Databases:
Hands-on experience with cloud environments such as AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda) and Microsoft Azure. Comfortable working with both SQL and NoSQL databases, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB, for scalable data storage and retrieval.
Data Management & Analysis:
Skilled in using Microsoft Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables, VBA) and Microsoft Access for business reporting. Familiar with processing large datasets and integrating big data systems to extract trends and drive strategic decisions.
Soft Skills & Collaboration:
Strong time management and organizational skills with a proven ability to work independently under tight deadlines. Highly adaptable, with a collaborative mindset and a solution-oriented approach to problem-solving across cross-functional teams.

English: Professional working proficiency
